reviews.review: This game is awesome. I love the two portal games and i highly recommend it to everyone. just hours and hours of fun filled brain twisters and the hilarious b**** computer :P

Jogo de puzzles ao seu próprio estilo. curti muito a idéia.

Portal is a spin-off to the Half-Life franchise, except it provides something different to offer. The game takes place entirely in a large advance lab facility called Aperture Labs. Half-Life fans might be familiar with that name as it was mentioned as Black Mesa's competitor in Half-Life 2: Episode 2. Confirming that the game is set in the same universe except focus on a different protagnogist. The main protagnogist is a woman named Chell who is a test subject for Aperture Labs. She awakens in her cell and is greeted by an AI named GlaDOS, who is like a female version of the Hal 9000. GlaDOS monitors Chell throughout the area she is confined in and soon is given instructions to participate in a series of tests in various obstacle courses with only a prototype "portal gun" as a tool to progress the tests. The portal gun is a highly advance device that shoots out two different rifts of portals: blue and orange. Anything going into the blue portal comes out of the orange portal and vice versa. As Chell goes on her trek of countless obstacles, she eventually discovers that there is something not right about the lab as the windows of the upper floors where the lab staff would normally be present are not there as the spectators and wonders if anyone is stationed at the lab than her. The game offers the same gameplay and layouts as the Half-Life games do except in this game you play as a heroine and the only weapon of choice is a portal gun which you have to use to your advancetage when dealing with various dangers. The puzzles are very well thought up and sometimes appear to be cryptic but there is a solution if you put your mind to it. Portal would go on to being an iconic game in the same level as Counter Strike & Half-Life. Anyone who loves those games will enjoy this game to the core.

One of the best games ever concieved. Elegantly simple, the game and its puzzles would have been clever and enjoyable, on their own, but the devious, wonderfully awful G.L.A.D.O.S imbues the game with tremendous personality. An absolute wonder!

Portal is a beatiful puzzle game! Where you are in a lab to be tested by a robot(in this moment I don't remember his name XD). The key of this game is the portal. You can across walls through two linked portal, that's very cool!
After some levels the game changes completely! I won't tell you how(SPOILER), but believe me it will be a great surprise ;)
BUY IT AND ENJOY YOURSELF!
A fun way to spend a few hours of your life. Perfect for the summer break.
Classic; must play. See my review of Portal 2 for more thoughts.

It's a delightfully clever physics FPS puzzler. It's not particularly hard nor particularly advanced, and it's pretty short, but at this price it's a no-brainer: if you haven't played it yet, buy it, play it, and discover why it's such a classic of the genre.

И без того отличный Half-Life умудрились геймплейно видоизменить до такой степени, что теперь это нечто потрясающее. Игра, на сколько мне известно, выросла из амбициозного любительского проекта, который поддержали Valve и впоследствии даже обзавелась собственным сиквелом. На мой счет это абсолютный must have!

Моё мнение: в нее должен поиграть каждый уважающий себя геймер и даже те которые ограничивают себя одной двумя играми, ибо безразличным она не оставит никого.

I first fell in love with the song Still Alive when my friend showed it to me on Rock Band. I got to see some gameplay through another friend. I never played it myself, but I became fascinated by GLaDOS and wanted to cosplay her. So I decided to play it. And my obsession began. I only regret not playing it sooner.

A bit brief.

Portal is an amazing game.  While it leads you through instructions and teaches you how to use devices in the test chambers, it's also leading you through a story.  This is more than just a puzzle game, and it's completely worth the money.  If you finish it, make sure to play Portal 2.  Also, this series corresponds with Half-Life, so play the Half-Life series and then this.
It still holds a special place in my heart :)
超级经典的好游戏
This is a different kind of puzzle game that challenges you to see things differently. It will forever be in my top 10 games of all time, and a wonderfully fun experience.

If you enjoy puzzles, you need to play this game. Even if you don't enjoy puzzles, you probably should play this game. It's just that good. I thought it was a strange concept when I first heard about it. "So it's a FPS, but I don't shoot bullets at bad guys? It's a platformer? That sounds stupid!" But I tried it and was floored! I couldn't stop playing it! It's great for developing problem solving skills, and it's funny.

Legitimately one of the best games ever made. Tight level design, excellent story, funny dialogue, inventive gameplay, clever puzzles, excellent pace, etc. Every night, I shed a tear for the people who have yet to play this game.

This seriously might just be my favourite game of all time, certainly high on the list.  It is such a well made game, in terms of both the design, and the execution.  The puzzles are fun, interesting and engaging, the honour is very well done, witty and sarcastic,  and it is just a fantastic game.  If you are AT ALL on the fence about buying this game, I cannot recommend this game enough, it simply is a must play.
Great game,  buy it, no regrets.

I enjoy puzzle games, so I bought Portal expecting some puzzles, and that's exactly what i got. It really makes you think, and challenges your brain to solve complicated problems. There's 19 main levels, [spoiler]a long escape level[/spoiler], and an [spoiler]ending boss fight.[/spoiler] It only takes a few hours to complete, but it's worth your money. The game isn't just a puzzle game, though. It has an interesting storyline, too. [spoiler]The ending of the game makes you wonder, "Well, what happens next?"[/spoiler] I bought both Portal and Portal 2 in a bundle, expecting that I would want to play the second game too, and I was right! Lots of people play only Portal 2 and not Portal, but I would highly reccomend playing Portal before even opening Portal 2. Fantastic game!

this game has great narration with many jokes, the puzzles are really good and it is deffinately worth your money espessially when the game is on a sale. it is a great game just buy it and see for yourself!

At first, I was kind of scared to play this game. I've never been very good at puzzles, and Portal is a game solely centered on solving "tests" in the form of cognitive interaction with the environment. However, upon purchasing the game and playing it for about a half hour, I was hooked. The first time you play through the game the puzzles are confusing and hard figure out (at least in my case). But after playing through a handful of times, they get progressively easier and display simple yet illusive formulas. They aren't just simple "place a cube here and continue to point B" challenges, but levels that make you think for a second before making a move. Often times a full understanding of what's around you is required to progress forward, and that's valuable in a game like this. When you beat an especially hard puzzle, you get an amazing feeling of success that pushes you forward until you finally beat the game and can reflect on what you just completed... And then play it from start to finish another ten times.
My Brain!!!

This game is such a joyful, challenging, and downright fantastic game to play. The puzzles are designed so well and they make you think outside of the box. I've only beaten the game once, but i know ill play it more and more.
